Message.Title: insider sellingand/or buying
Message.Msg: Looks to me that the insiders are all selling. I could find no buying. So if you want to know why the pps won't go up you might say that some of the problem is insider pressure down. When the workers are peddling then there is a real problem inside.
Then their selling CHEAP - Price Target Summary Mean Target: 15.58 Median Target: 15.25 High Target: 21.00 Low Target: 12.00

"So where will the PPS be in a year, you think? And where will annualized share earnings be? I like the new, more stable stock price, too, just wish the shares were trading in the $20s, not the $12s..." mslans First the annualized share earnings: 1 year $1.15 GAAP, $1.40 Non GAAP 2 year $1.50 GAAP, #1.75 Non GAAP Price per share: 1 year $16.50 2 year $21.00 Dividend: Now $0.075 per quarter 1 year $0.09 per quarter 2 year $0.11 per quarter And You?

Well, your earnings numbers seem low, given Q3 GAAP and non-GAAP earnings of $0.33 and $0.39, respectively. I figure annualized GAAP earnings should be $1.30 or higher in a year. If we put a 15x multiple on that (reasonable for GAAP EPS, I'd say), the PPS would be near $20... And if the chips get hot (and they're due), we could be in the $20s by the start of 2014... Too optimistic?

"Well, your earnings numbers seem low, given Q3 GAAP and non-GAAP earnings of $0.33 and $0.39, respectively. I figure annualized GAAP earnings should be $1.30 or higher in a year." mslans $1.30 in annualized GAAP earnings does seem possible! Especially since the Senate last night included a reinstatement of the R&D tax credit. If the House passes the Fiscal Cliff Bill as is today, Nvidia's US income tax rate will drop by 4 percentage points. About $10M to $12M a quarter adding $0.08 to annualized earnings. PPS would be near $20 in a year. Too Optimistic? mslans There is very good chance you are right, but IMHO only if Tegra is breakeven in the 2nd half of the year. If this happens, WS Analysts would jump their earnings estimates driving the stock price upward. Let's hope the die shrink to 28nm from 40nm kickstarts Tegra gross margins in 2013 like it did for Geforce gross margins in 2012. But I cannot overemphasize the importance of Nvidia paying a dividend. This and the stock buyback(if happening) has effectively changed Nvidia from a speculative play to an investment. Because of this, I intend to hold my stock because I doubt I will ever again be able to buy at $11.50 a share again no matter how much the day trading stock boys try to influence the stock price through postings or articles on the internet. Bet they move on to some other play sooner rather than later. JMHO

So Best? Chief Executive Officer Jen doesn’t get any bonus for 2012, does he? I would hope not. The guy’s “leadership” was bad during 2012. Oh so Bad. Jen’s company underperformed the S&P 500 by (-27.67%) Which is clearly a sign of bad leadership, right? It sure is. Well okay. Maybe bad vision, bad strategy, and bad execution too. Jen selling all of nvidia’s IP to Intel Corporation wasn’t the best move either. And since Jen is the titular head of this misguided outfit – he is responsible. It would be a crime if Jen’s hand-picked, sock puppet Board of Toadies votes to pay the guy any bonus for 2012. The Big Dog owners of nvidia will most assuredly be outraged. Yes, Outraged, boys. Even more outraged than they were about going 19 years without a dividend. Outraged about how on earth a Chief Executive Officer of a company turning in negative alpha of (-27.67%) could possibly earn any Bonus. And they will probably use their Monte Blancs to check some different proxy circles. You know, where it says “Re-Election of Directors”. Heck, they might even write-in a few hand-picked names of their own. The outraged Big Dog owners can do that, don't u know.
Thanks !

Agreed, Best. It would not only be a crime to pay current CEO Jen any bonus for 2012, it would go against nvidia's own duly approved Corporate Governance. And I quote: Executive Compensation "Our compensation program is designed to attract, retain and motivate a talented, innovative and entrepreneurial team of executives. To do so, we believe that the vast majority of their compensation should be based on performance, both of the individual and of the business." "The vast majority of Jen's compensation should be based on performance of the business." With negative alpha of (-27.67%) versus the peer group S&P 500, nvidia's performance was really bad. Really Really Bad. Here. You can read it yourself. Google this : Governance - Nvidia Let's hope the Board follows their own duly approved Corporate Governance. And gives Jen a goose egg for a bonus. 'Cause as the above section entitled "Governance" says, "From and after the 2014 Annual Meeting, all directors will stand for election annually."
RMBS RMBS WAH WAH WAH

stock market is forward looking - all this is already baked in and has Nvidia barely holding 12. At this point market is skeptical that Nvidia can hold on its own against Qualcomm, Mediatek and Intel going forward. Nvidia needs to hit the cover of the ball with an Icera LTE solution. Beyond Icera 410 and AT&T approval, nothing new was announced in all of 2012. I hope Nvidia has something new to announce at CES, but they are already late for 1H2013 products and revenues.

"Nvidia needs to hit the cover of the ball with an Icera LTE solution. Beyond Icera 410 and AT&T approval, nothing new was announced in all of 2012. I hope Nvidia has something new to announce at CES, but they are already late for 1H2013 products and revenues." A whole two years after T3, and $700M of Tegra loses later, how about the paper spec for T4? As for being late for 1H2013 products and revenues... ah, a press release and a press conference is worth a whole lot more than that, non? Nvda is all lined up to lose $400M in Tegras this year, and the longs want the stock to do what?

Message.Title: NVDA should hit $12.50 near the open - techs are $$$$$$$$$
Message.Msg: Should be a good day Wed.

Topic.Title: NVDA should hit $12.50 near the open - techs are $$$$$$$$$

Message.Msg: NVDA is up 1.32% to $12.26 today... Quotes Find Symbol NVDA is ahead of the Semiconductors industry average today.

"Let's hope the Board follows their own duly approved Corporate Governance. And gives Jen a goose egg for a bonus. 'Cause as the above section entitled "Governance" says, "From and after the 2014 Annual Meeting, all directors will stand for election annually." It's ironic, yes? It sure is. In most election campaigns, spending More results in a higher chance of winning. More advertising and yard signs and this and that = Victory at the Polls. But not in the re-election of nvidia directors to their cushy jobs. Oh no no no. It's just the opposite. The less they spend on Jen's bonus -- the more likely the Big Dogs will vote for them. Did I mention? It's ironic, right?

Absolutely have to disagree that it's mobile wins are baked in. What's baked in is the risk of a PC centeric company. The mobile stuff hasn't stuck yet, but I would agree they need to announce new wins, products and hopefully an SoC complete with base-band. This should finally give some legitimacy to it's mobile division. If that doesn't then nothing will. BTW: House looks to be conceding and willing to accept the Senate Bill so we should have a dandy Wednesday, add some CES momentum and news and we may see 13.25 in less than a couple weeks.

If there is a rally tomorrow - far from certain, market rallied on Dec 31 in anticipation already, longs should take the opportunity to unload. There is an increasing likelihood that Nvidia will either pre-announce a warning or, actually miss on estimates when they announce earnings. I don't have a position in Nvidia here - but I will certainly look at shorting Nvidia above 13. Fiscal Cliff was just a taste of things to come, its all austerity from here on out. Debt limit and sequester cuts.

Message.Title: Inventory of NVDA
Message.Msg: I long NVDA but I have concern about its inventory, which increases continuously in the last two quarter. Does anyone have some insight information?

"If there is a rally tomorrow - far from certain, market rallied on Dec 31 in anticipation already, longs should take the opportunity to unload." New Years Eve was a light trading day, however nothing is for certain but if a deal gets passed I imagine it will be well received. "There is an increasing likelihood that Nvidia will either pre-announce a warning or, actually miss on estimates when they announce earnings." And you're basing this on???????????? "Fiscal Cliff was just a taste of things to come, its all austerity from here on out. Debt limit and sequester cuts" Yeah sure just one hill in the roller-coaster ride, but the market is so short sighted the reality of that won't set in for a while and this is general to the market not just Nvidia. The flip side of this argument is the economy is improving in spite of beltway incompetence, and companies have hoards of cash that need to be put to good use. Wouldn't going short as the market rallies and Nvidia moves upward defy your technical discipline?

Message.Title: Futures all green .......................... Up 70 on the NASQ!!!

Topic.Title: Nvidia tegra out. Samsung Exynos in.

Message.Msg: "Previously, the Mont-Blanc project was co-developed by Barcelona Supercomputing Center and Nvidia Corp., but it looks like the latter is no longer a part of the project." So Best? Regarding the mystery of why the Monte-Blanc European supercomputer builders would suddenly kick nvidia's tegra to the curb -- and go with the Samsung Exynos processors instead. Might it be because the European supercomputer builders either know, -- or suspect -- that the horrendous loss-generating "tegra" ARM chip folly could be cancelled soon? You know. Like TI recently did with their OMAP chips. In which case those European supercomputer builders in Barcelona would be, well, "hasta un riachuelo sin una paleta". That's "Up a creek without a paddle", boys.
I suspect that you'd be selling some those free shares as well if there was a high probability of capital gains taxes and dividend taxes for your income bracket were going to double.

"There is an increasing likelihood that Nvidia will either pre-announce a warning or, actually miss on estimates when they announce earnings." And you're basing this on???????????? See Analyst comments (as opposed to consensus .24c/$1.1B for Q4, FY14 .95/$4.54B) Nvidia: For FY Q4, Wang now sees revenue of $1.07 billion and profits of 21 cents a share, down from $1.09 billion and 22 cents. For FY 2014, he sees $4.3 billion and a profit of 85 cents a share, down from $4.4 billion and 88 cents.

That retort seems a bit weak O. I've seen the estimates but estimates have a range and putting stock in any analysts predictions let a lone one is, in my opinion, ill fated. I trust sell sides less than I trust news outlet like Seeking Alpha or MF. Analysts have a better track record of being wrong than they do being right. If you follow basics it all just look into how bad they are at predicting demand and IO prices. GS downgraded a few metal stocks and now they have egg on there face as china and capacity turned their predictions upside down. I am not saying he'll be wrong but I wouldn't bet my hard earned dollars him being right. In light of the recent economic data and tablet sales I could make an argument for an upgrade.

Looks like you want to take a contrary view - look at the estimates 90, 60, 30 days etc. you see the trend. I am not advocating shorting the stock here - but its easy money to short above 13, unless something fundamental in Nvidia product portfolio has changed and there are new growth drivers.

Message.Title: Looks Like All Usual Day Traders Are Posting Tonight.
I made be a day trader - but I am long NVDA tonight.......
Message.Msg: I will hold till at least tomorrow if NVDA hits $13.00.

Good point, Best. About the irony that the less they spend on Jen's bonus, the more likely that the Big Dog owners will vote for them. a Which I believe, after the 2014 Annual Meeting, each and every nvidia director will stand for election Annually.

Not really contrarian - I just don't put any stock in analysts right or wrong as very few get it right. So, the vote passed and foreign markets have already moved up ~1.25 on average on the news. This should be at least some indication of what we see tomorrow, it will be interesting to see what stocks are affected and were NVDA stands at the 10am and 2pm. We should get a good idea of who cautiously sold ahead of this debacle and who was holding off buying until this was resolved. Should be interesting..,,Also, curious if press releases start coming out now that macro issues are weighing less on the market.

Message.Title: House Passes Bill to Avoid Fiscal Cliff - FUTURES GREEN$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$
Message.Msg: House Passes Bill to Avoid Fiscal Cliff The GOP-dominated House voted in favor of a bill to block middle class tax increases and government spending cuts in a late-night New Year's Day session. House Passes Bill to Avoid Fiscal Cliff The GOP-dominated House voted in favor of a bill to block middle class tax increases and government spending cuts in a late-night New Year's Day session. House Passes Bill to Avoid Fiscal Cliff The GOP-dominated House voted in favor of a bill to block middle class tax increases and government spending cuts in a late-night New Year's Day session.

Message.Title: Don't Forget R&D Tax Credit Extended
Message.Msg: Means a couple of pennies per quarter more for Nvidia's earnings. Wonder if Analysts will adjust earnings projections now or wait? I don't expect a big pop tomorrow just a nice steady upward move along with the market. Believe it will last into and thru CES next week. Of course their could be some short panic though.
